titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the South African subject collection
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Katherine Reynolds and Aparna Mukherjee; machine-readable finding aid created by Xiuzhi Zhou

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2018-01-30T16:19-0800

change.item: January 19, 2018: update of sound recordings verbiage. - JS <date calendar="gregorian" normal="20111206" era="ce">December 6, 2011</date><item>updated extent statement and encoding after increment</item></change><change><date calendar="gregorian" normal="20040323" era="ce">March 23, 2004</date><item>PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::South African subject collection)//EN" "reg_030.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).</item></change><change><date calendar="gregorian" normal="20120730" era="ce">July 30, 2012</date><item>Revised to update encoding and add unitid by Jill Golden</item>

physdesc.extent: 65 manuscript boxes, 5 oversize boxes, 9 phonorecords, 10 phonotape cassettes, 1 phonotape reel, 18 videotape cassettes.

did.abstract: Pamphlets, serial issues, reports, leaflets, election campaign literature, flyers, newsletters, other printed matter, letters, sound recordings and video tapes, relating to political, social and economic conditions, apartheid and race relations, and elections in South Africa; revolutionary movements in South Africa, especially the African National Congress; international support groups, especially in the United States, for such movements; and campus movements in the United States protesting investment in South Africa.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], South African subject collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog Socrates at http://library.stanford.edu/webcat. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in Socrates is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Articles, brochures, clippings, ephemera, flyers, newspapers, pamphlets, reports and speeches relating to economic, political and social conditions in South Africa. Arranged alphabetically by subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Brochures, calendars, ephemera, newsletters and pamphlets relating to international involvement in the issue of apartheid in South Africa. Arranged alphabetically by title of organization. Relates to international involvement in South Africa and to some extent southern Africa in general. Consult African Subject Collection for additional material.

did.unittitle: Afrikagrupperna i Sverige. Includes material on Namibia

Council for the Defense of Freedom - Alliance for African
Covenant Against Apartheid Home and Abroad Program
Episcopal Churchpeople for South Africa (formerly Episcopal Churchmen for South Africa). Includes material on Namibia

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Articles, clippings, communiques, ephemera, pamphlets, press releases, reports, speeches and statements primarily relating to revolutionary activities of the African National Congress and the Pan Africanist Congress of Azania. Arranged alphabetically by name of movement.

Pan Africanist Congress of Azania (PAC of Azania)
Policies and principles of the PAC
Legal status of the South African government as viewed by the PAC

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Brochures, newsletters and pamphlets relating to international investment and divestment in South Africa.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Articles, clippings, flyers, newsletters and student newspapers relating to American university student protest of apartheid. Arranged alphabetically by the name of the university.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Ballot papers, brochures, clippings, correspondence, election reports and updates, fact sheets, flyers, handbook, manuals, newsletters, pamphlets, press release, printed matter, reports, statements, speeches and miscellany relating to the election of 1994 and the process of establishing democratic government in South Africa. See also POLITICAL PARTIES.

did.unittitle: South African University Students' Representative Council (SRC)
List for National Assembly and Regional Legislatures

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Brochures, flyers, clippings, newsletters, and printed matter relating to the various aspects of life in South Africa.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tee shirts and other souvenirs relating to the election of 1994.

did.unittitle: Campaign materials from election 1994,including tee shirts and tie

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes sample ballot papers; calendars published by the African National Congress, the American Committee on Africa, the Open School on the Move, and the Holland Committee on Southern Africa; flyers and newspapers from various student organizations at the University of Cape Town and the University of Witwatersrand; printed matter and photographic reproductions of Nelson Mandela.

did.unittitle: "African National Congress: A Time For Candor," n.d.
"Freedomfest Concert; Observation of Nelson Mandela's Birthday," Two videotape cassettes
"Revolution and Betrayal: The Accelerating Onslaught Against South Africa,"
"South Africa: The Mainstay of the Southern African Region,"
"Year of the Struggle," Two videotape cassettes

NP Liedjies gesing en gekomponeer deur Peter Marais, National Party Election Songs, Election In Afrikaans

"Radio Freedom," African National Congress and the People's Army Umkhonto We Sizwe,

"South Africa: Time Out For Realism, the Story the Media Refuses to Reveal,"
"Give Praise where Praise is Deserved: A Tribute Album to Our Nobel Prize Winner Bishop Desmond Tutu,"
"Kick Over the Statues! Azania Coming Soon,"
"Why You Should Vote NP," personal message from P.W. Botha,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This addition to the collection has not yet been described. Please let the Hoover Institution Archives know if you would like to see this material described.
